channel.title: Admin panel settings on Moxly App Builder Help
channel.description: Recent content in Admin panel settings on Moxly App Builder Help

item.title: Admin account
item.description:
Default account #

Immediately after installation, the first thing (for security reasons) is to change the data of the default account of the platform administrator.

Default data after installation: login admin@admin.com password: admin.

And so, to replace the data with your own, go to the My Profile page by clicking on the icon next to the Name on the left in the site header.

Also, change the passwords or disable the accounts manager@manager.com and customer@customer.com.

item.title: Dashboard
item.description:
Dashboard #

The dashboard displays the latest registrations from the past 30 days, the latest payments from the past 30 days, the total number of users, the total number of applications, the number of applications in the build queue, and the number of blocked applications. Additionally, if there are requests for linking custom domains, this information is also shown on the main screen. Furthermore, if a platform update is available, a notification will appear on the main screen.

item.title: SMTP settings
item.description:
SMTP settings #

The program uses email notifications during registration and password recovery.

Enter your details. You can obtain this information from your provider.

item.title: Domain settings
item.description:
Domain settings #

And so, to configure the parameters of the domain and administrator’s e-mail, as well as the system user name, you need:

  1. Select “Domain Settings”.
  2. In field 1, specify the main Domain where your platform is located.
  3. In field 2, the system Email from which notifications will be sent to your clients and users.
  4. In field 2 specify a system username that will also be seen by your clients and users.
  5. After filling in the fields, be sure to click “Save Changes”.

item.title: Users registration
item.description:
Users registration #

You can change the possibility of registration of new users.

If registration is disabled, new users will not be able to register. However, previously registered users will still be able to operate. Additionally, you can manually add a user.

item.title: Trial period
item.description:
Trial period settings #

You can set the number of trial days for users. After these days expire, billing will start for the user.

0 - without trial

item.title: Build queue
item.description:
User application build queue #

Applications are added to the queue and then build sequentially, depending on the build mode. If necessary, some applications can be removed from the build queue.

item.title: Download SDK and Logs
item.description:
Donwload SDK and tools for app build #

Installing the SDKs and tools required to properly generate Android, WWW, IOS, Sources and PWA applications some applications can be removed from the build queue.

We recommend installing libraries via NPM – this ensures using the latest versions of these libraries.

The installation process may take some time. To ensure the installation works properly, you need to configure Cron (see Cron setup in the Installation section).

item.title: Platform updates
item.description:
License Information #

Here you can view your license number and its status, activate or deactivate it.

A platform with an inactive license will not receive updates.

Platform Update #

  1. In the side menu, go to the “Updates and modules”.
  2. Select a subsection (tab) “Platform update”.
  3. Check for updates by clicking the “Check now” button.
  4. If there are updates, then click the “Update now” button below.

item.title: Payment systems
item.description:
Stripe #

To connect Stripe, you need to fill in the form with the required details. You can obtain this information from Stripe.

Please note that these settings must be configured for each plan. Each plan offers two payment options: monthly or yearly. Consider this in your pricing strategy.

Paypal #

Paypal is not supported at this moment. Will be released in next versions.

item.title: Currency
item.description:
Default currency #

The default currency in the system is used for user billing calculations.

item.title: Pricing plans
item.description:
Pricing plan configuration #

Plans #

Up to 4 pricing plans can be configured.

The total number of pricing plans can be unlimited, but no more than 4 can be active at a time. The remaining plans will be archived.

A pricing plan can only be deleted if it is not in use. If at least one user is assigned to the plan, it cannot be deleted.

item.title: Languages
item.description:
Languages and translations #

The system offers automatic translation management. The number of translations can be unlimited. Translations are added through the admin panel. Translations can be edited if necessary. And previously added ones can be deleted.

Default language #

By default, English is used, but it can always be changed in the settings, and any of the added languages can be set as the default language.
